qas.question: What year did Dahabhiil acquire the majority of Somtal network?
Buying Somtal Network allowed Dahabshiil to expand into what type of banking?
The STC allows its customers to communicate across how many networks?
Who is Dahabshiil Group's partner in the Somtel Network?
Who owned the majority of Somtel Network before Dahabshiil?
How many networks do STC customers still not have access to?
What industry is growing in the national banking sector?
When will the STC be fully established?

context: In <a0_0>2008<a0_0/>, Dahabshiil Group acquired a majority stake in Somtel Network, a <a1_0><b6_0>Hargeisa<b6_0/><a1_0/>-based telecommunications firm specialising in high speed broadband, mobile internet, LTE services, mobile money transfer and mobile phone services. The acquisition provided Dahabshiil with the necessary platform for a subsequent expansion into <a2_0><b8_0>mobile banking<b8_0/><a2_0/>, a growth industry in the regional banking sector. In <b9_0>2014<b9_0/>, Somalia's <a4_0>three<a4_0/> largest telecommunication operators, <b5_0>Hormuud Telecom, NationLink<b5_0/> and Somtel, also signed an interconnection agreement. The cooperative deal will see the firms establish the <a3_0>Somali Telecommunication Company<a3_0/> (STC), which will allow their mobile clients to communicate across the <b7_0>three<b7_0/> networks.
